recommended_movies: Wallace & Gromit: The Best of Aardman Animation (1996)
Wallace & Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit (2005)

simulated_ratings.title: Napoleon Dynamite (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Awkward, deadpan humor and small-town weirdness I find endearing.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart, inventive slapstick with dry British wit is right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Best of Aardman Animation (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Consistently clever shorts with warmth and wit, with only minor dips.

simulated_ratings.title: Opposite of Sex, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Acerbic, messy characters and barbed humor mostly work for me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Dawns Here are Quiet (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Somber, character-focused war story that feels humane and gripping.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Buoyant, witty and playful without getting cloying.

simulated_ratings.title: Christmas Story, A (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sardonic nostalgia and low-key laughs beat holiday schmaltz.
The themes resonate, though the older staging blunts some impact.

simulated_ratings.title: Tora! Tora! Tora! (1970)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Procedural war history is absorbing if a bit stiff.

simulated_ratings.title: Buffalo '66 (a.k.a. Buffalo 66) (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Offbeat, prickly and oddly tender hits my indie sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: The War (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, churchy sitcom vibes and canned humor leave me cold.

simulated_ratings.title: 56 Up (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Decades-spanning, humane observation that fascinates start to finish.

simulated_ratings.title: Barbarella (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Campy sci-fi fluff that amuses briefly but wears thin fast.

simulated_ratings.title: Claymation Christmas Celebration, A (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cute and occasionally witty, but mostly disposable holiday fluff.

simulated_ratings.title: Pledge, The (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, patient crime drama with moral weight I appreciate.

simulated_ratings.title: Igby Goes Down (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Caustic, witty teen malaise that mostly lands despite some smugness.

simulated_ratings.title: Little Witch Academia (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Energetic and sweet, but the fantasy trappings don’t grab me.

simulated_ratings.title: Goldfinger (1964)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Iconic fun with style, though I’m not fully swept up by Bond.

simulated_ratings.title: Decline of Western Civilization Part II: The Metal Years, The (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Entertaining snapshot with some bite, even if the scene isn’t my thing.

simulated_ratings.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing (a.k.a. 13 Conversations) (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Thoughtful, interwoven melancholy that I find quietly compelling.

simulated_ratings.title: Glengarry Glen Ross (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Scalpel-sharp dialogue and desperation—my kind of pressure cooker.

simulated_ratings.title: Doubt (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Taut performances and moral ambiguity keep me engaged.

simulated_ratings.title: One Day in September (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Riveting, clear-eyed and deeply unsettling—excellent doc work.

simulated_ratings.title: Chicken Run (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, spirited escape caper with Aardman charm to spare.

simulated_ratings.title: Happiness (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bold, dark and queasy

simulated_ratings.title: Holiday Affair (1949)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle and pleasant, but the old-fashioned romance feels thin to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Barcelona (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dry, talky wit and cultural prickliness that I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Baseball (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light blooper fare that’s fine background but little more.

simulated_ratings.title: Dr. No (1962)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Solid, breezy starter Bond

simulated_ratings.title: Rent (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest bohemian melodrama feels strident and not my tempo.

simulated_ratings.title: Cheech & Chong's Nice Dreams (1981)

simulated_ratings.title: Walk on the Moon, A (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sincere but the adultery romance doesn't hook me.

simulated_ratings.title: Southern Comfort (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Humane, intimate doc that moved me deeply.

simulated_ratings.title: Family, The (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mafia-in-hiding shenanigans are intermittently amusing but thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Haunted World of Edward D. Wood Jr., The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Affectionate, lively overview that satisfies my pop-culture curiosity.

simulated_ratings.title: Chicago (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever razzle-dazzle, but the musical gloss keeps me at arm's length.

simulated_ratings.title: Love! Valour! Compassion! (1997)

simulated_ratings.title: God Said 'Ha!' (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wry, candid and quietly affecting.

simulated_ratings.title: Sicarivs: The Night and the Silence (2015)

simulated_ratings.title: Cure for Love, A (Lekarstwo na milosc) (1966)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light caper charm and dry wit hit a pleasant groove.

simulated_ratings.title: Women, The (1939)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Catty wit is there, but the dated attitudes sap it.

simulated_ratings.title: Sisters in Law (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clear-eyed, compelling justice stories that stick with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Good Day to Die Hard, A (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Noisy, weightless spectacle that I quickly forget.

simulated_ratings.title: Marc Maron: From Bleak to Dark (2023)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Acerbic, personal and smartly observed - my kind of hour.

simulated_ratings.title: Scream 2 (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Self-aware slashing has its moments but little tension for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Girl, Positive (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest message piece that feels a bit TV-flat.

simulated_ratings.title: Without Limits (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Solid biopic craft with enough character drive to hold me.

simulated_ratings.title: Trailer Park Boys: Say Goodnight to the Bad Guys (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Scruffy hijinks land sporadic laughs, mostly shrug-worthy.

simulated_ratings.title: Man on a Tightrope (1953)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sturdy, tense escape drama with human stakes.

simulated_ratings.title: Hamlet (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Impressive but the classical delivery keeps me at a remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Bangkok Dangerous (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Generic assassin beats with occasional mood, little resonance.

simulated_ratings.title: Cruise, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky, humane character study that fascinates.

simulated_ratings.title: Crash (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cool, unsettling kink piece that intrigues more than it moves me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Kids Are Alright (1979)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Energetic, engaging rock doc even if the scene isn't my thing.

simulated_ratings.title: Tom Jones (1963)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Roguish frolic is amiable, if a bit overlong and arch.

simulated_ratings.title: Jackass 3D (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gross-out stunts exhaust me almost immediately.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2, The (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: CGI vampire clan politics can’t overcome the swoony YA melodrama that turns me off.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight Saga: Eclipse, The (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slightly more momentum, but the love triangle soapiness still keeps me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1, The (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy honeymoon angst and supernatural pregnancy melodrama just isn’t my tempo.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brooding teen romance with fantasy trappings leaves me cold despite the mood.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight Saga: New Moon, The (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Prolonged heartbreak and werewolf detours feel like empty teen angst to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Paulie (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet and earnest

simulated_ratings.title: The Last Mountain (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Absorbing, clear mountain doc with human stakes and nerve.

simulated_ratings.title: Pokémon: The First Movie (1998)

simulated_ratings.title: Speed Zone! (a.k.a. Cannonball Run III) (1989)

simulated_ratings.title: Sicko (2007)

simulated_ratings.title: West Side Story (1961)

simulated_ratings.title: Beaches (1988)

simulated_ratings.title: Operation Dunaj (2009)

simulated_ratings.title: Reindeer Games (2000)

simulated_ratings.title: Jesus Christ Superstar (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inventive in spots, but the rock-opera delivery keeps me detached.

simulated_ratings.title: Lemon (1969)

simulated_ratings.title: Month by the Lake, A (1995)

simulated_ratings.title: Michael Jackson's This Is It (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Respectful and occasionally stirring, but I’m only mildly invested.

simulated_ratings.title: Saint of Fort Washington, The (1993)

simulated_ratings.title: Throw Momma from the Train (1987)

simulated_ratings.title: 8 Heads in a Duffel Bag (1997)

simulated_ratings.title: DreamWorks Home: For the Holidays (2017)

simulated_ratings.title: Christmas Carol, A (1938)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic moral tale played earnestly

simulated_ratings.title: Jane Austen's Mafia! (1998)

simulated_ratings.title: My Name is Khan (2010)

simulated_ratings.title: Them! (1954)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sturdy 50s sci-fi procedural fun, enjoyable but not especially gripping.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, urgent reconstruction with human stakes that I respect more than I love.

simulated_ratings.title: Batman Beyond Darwyn Cooke's Batman 75th Anniversary Short (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stylish, punchy nostalgia that scratches the Batman itch without much depth.

simulated_ratings.title: John Mulaney: Kid Gorgeous at Radio City (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, well-crafted hour with smart, acerbic bits that land for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Daria: Is It Fall Yet? (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dry, sardonic teen wit and low-key melancholy are right in my wheelhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: Revenge of the Pink Panther (1978)
